poem:
**Absentia**  

In the familiar hum of absent voices,  
the summit spins its orbit, silent  
as a clock-hand on a country wall.  
No eager footfalls on polished floors,  
no echo of ambitions packed in suitcases—  
only the wind rehearsing its lines,  
sweeping the maps without a country  
to speak its piece or listen.
